issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
You all are correct that `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres` is an invalid URI because the `host`, if a UNIX domain socket, must be an absolute path. So, why was my setup with that URI working for years? This commit show us why: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181

`query_hash.merge` would drop the `host` param, and then `libpg` would, unbeknownst to me (but this makes sense!) fall back to `$PGHOST` env var which was set by [per-project Postgres config](https://jamey.thesharps.us/2019/05/29/per-project-postgres/) to `$(pwd)/postgres` which became `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres`.

My setup broke after https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181 because `query_hash.reverse_merge` would do the right thing and properly pass on `host`, which as said before, as a relative path, was invalid!

I was surprised to see this break between an alpha and an rc for something that had worked for years, but it's better that I clean this all up anyway. Thank you all for helping me sort through it (@larskanis your inline Gemfile technique was :kissing_closed_eyes: :ok_hand:) and I hope that this can help someone that runs into this situation in the future (though honestly I may be the unique snowflake :snowflake: :laughing:)

issue.title: Private hex repo support
issue.body:
This PR addresses https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/1286

Underneath, this required pretty minimal changes to the existing hex updater/checker code. Figuring out how to make the modifications and recognizing that all of the other tests made actual HTTP calls took most of the time.

Currently, it automatically fetches the `public_key` and doesn't perform any verification against a fingerprint. I opted out of adding `public_key` support initially because most repo consumers don't have direct access to the `public_key` anyhow, and they'd have to fetch it the same way.  It would be trivial to accept a `public_key` option or a `fingerprint` for verification.

A minimal server that has two versions of the `jason` package is now hosted on a free fly.io instance at dependabot-private.fly.dev. The hex server's source is here: https://github.com/sorentwo/dependabot-private-repo. (I'm happy to transfer the repository or the instance over to dependabot.)

comment.body: As an Oban Pro user, I appreciate everyone's work on this PR! If I can help test, please let me know.

After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'

# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `require_relative'

pull_request.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module

# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
You all are correct that `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres` is an invalid URI because the `host`, if a UNIX domain socket, must be an absolute path. So, why was my setup with that URI working for years? This commit show us why: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181

`query_hash.merge` would drop the `host` param, and then `libpg` would, unbeknownst to me (but this makes sense!) fall back to `$PGHOST` env var which was set by [per-project Postgres config](https://jamey.thesharps.us/2019/05/29/per-project-postgres/) to `$(pwd)/postgres` which became `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres`.

My setup broke after https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181 because `query_hash.reverse_merge` would do the right thing and properly pass on `host`, which as said before, as a relative path, was invalid!

I was surprised to see this break between an alpha and an rc for something that had worked for years, but it's better that I clean this all up anyway. Thank you all for helping me sort through it (@larskanis your inline Gemfile technique was :kissing_closed_eyes: :ok_hand:) and I hope that this can help someone that runs into this situation in the future (though honestly I may be the unique snowflake :snowflake: :laughing:)

issue.title: Private hex repo support
issue.body:
This PR addresses https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/1286

Underneath, this required pretty minimal changes to the existing hex updater/checker code. Figuring out how to make the modifications and recognizing that all of the other tests made actual HTTP calls took most of the time.

Currently, it automatically fetches the `public_key` and doesn't perform any verification against a fingerprint. I opted out of adding `public_key` support initially because most repo consumers don't have direct access to the `public_key` anyhow, and they'd have to fetch it the same way.  It would be trivial to accept a `public_key` option or a `fingerprint` for verification.

A minimal server that has two versions of the `jason` package is now hosted on a free fly.io instance at dependabot-private.fly.dev. The hex server's source is here: https://github.com/sorentwo/dependabot-private-repo. (I'm happy to transfer the repository or the instance over to dependabot.)

comment.body: As an Oban Pro user, I appreciate everyone's work on this PR! If I can help test, please let me know.

issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: Update: I figured it out and tracked it down to a change in how ActiveRecord prepares the config URL. I'll write it up and make sure to link it here for those that are interested.

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `require_relative'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
Run options: include {:focus=>true}
```

The change itself is backward compatible as `puma/detect` exists in [v4.0.0](https://github.com/puma/puma/blob/v4.0.0/lib/puma/detect.rb)

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
You all are correct that `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres` is an invalid URI because the `host`, if a UNIX domain socket, must be an absolute path. So, why was my setup with that URI working for years? This commit show us why: https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181

`query_hash.merge` would drop the `host` param, and then `libpg` would, unbeknownst to me (but this makes sense!) fall back to `$PGHOST` env var which was set by [per-project Postgres config](https://jamey.thesharps.us/2019/05/29/per-project-postgres/) to `$(pwd)/postgres` which became `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres`.

My setup broke after https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c9b25c89ae4372008be0380df6a659d8989ec181 because `query_hash.reverse_merge` would do the right thing and properly pass on `host`, which as said before, as a relative path, was invalid!

I was surprised to see this break between an alpha and an rc for something that had worked for years, but it's better that I clean this all up anyway. Thank you all for helping me sort through it (@larskanis your inline Gemfile technique was :kissing_closed_eyes: :ok_hand:) and I hope that this can help someone that runs into this situation in the future (though honestly I may be the unique snowflake :snowflake: :laughing:)

issue.title: Private hex repo support
issue.body:
This PR addresses https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/1286

Underneath, this required pretty minimal changes to the existing hex updater/checker code. Figuring out how to make the modifications and recognizing that all of the other tests made actual HTTP calls took most of the time.

Currently, it automatically fetches the `public_key` and doesn't perform any verification against a fingerprint. I opted out of adding `public_key` support initially because most repo consumers don't have direct access to the `public_key` anyhow, and they'd have to fetch it the same way.  It would be trivial to accept a `public_key` option or a `fingerprint` for verification.

A minimal server that has two versions of the `jason` package is now hosted on a free fly.io instance at dependabot-private.fly.dev. The hex server's source is here: https://github.com/sorentwo/dependabot-private-repo. (I'm happy to transfer the repository or the instance over to dependabot.)

comment.body: As an Oban Pro user, I appreciate everyone's work on this PR! If I can help test, please let me know.

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body:
I can't track it down exactly, but it's from a change between ActiveRecord 7.0.0.alpha2 and 7.0.0.rc1. I'll go looking over there to see if it's worth reporting, but `pg` is getting the absolute path when my repro works, so not an issue here.

For the curious:

```ruby
require 'bundler/inline'

gemfile do
  source 'https://rubygems.org'
  gem "pg", "1.4.4"
  alpha_or_rc = ENV["BUSTED"] ? "rc1" : "alpha2"
  gem "activerecord", "7.0.0.#{alpha_or_rc}"
  gem "pry", "~> 0.13.1"
end

require "active_record"
require "pry"

puts "pg version: #{PG::VERSION}"
puts "AR version: #{ActiveRecord.version()}"

host = ".direnv/postgres"
url = "postgres:///pg?host=#{host}"

pool = ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
  adapter: "postgresql",
  url: url
)
p pool.db_config

binding.pry if ENV["DEBUG"]
conn = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.raw_connection
p conn.host
```

```
~/pg via 💎 v2.7.5 took 2s
❯ ruby pg.rb

issue.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
issue.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `require_relative'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
Run options: include {:focus=>true}
```

The change itself is backward compatible as `puma/detect` exists in [v4.0.0](https://github.com/puma/puma/blob/v4.0.0/lib/puma/detect.rb)

Tested via:

<details>

pull_request.title: Chore: bump max Puma version to 6.0
pull_request.body:
With the new Puma release, I'm proposing a bump of the max Puma version to 6.0. 

Due to a slight change of logic in Puma  - using `Puma.mri?` in a constant ([Puma::Configuration](https://github.com/puma/puma/compare/v5.0.0...v6.0.0#diff-2dc4e3e83be7fd97cebc482ae07d6a8216944003de82458783fb00b5ae9524c8R147)) I needed to introduce explicit `require 'puma/detect'` otherwise we will see 

```ruby
An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma/runner_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'

An error occurred while loading ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require 'puma/configuration'

NoMethodError:
  undefined method `mri?' for Puma:Module
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:147:in `<class:Configuration>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:128:in `<module:Puma>'
# /usr/local/bundle/gems/puma-6.0.0/lib/puma/configuration.rb:8:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `require'
# ./lib/guard/puma/runner.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `require_relative'
# ./lib/guard/puma.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `require'
# ./spec/lib/guard/puma_spec.rb:2:in `<top (required)>'
Run options: include {:focus=>true}
```

The change itself is backward compatible as `puma/detect` exists in [v4.0.0](https://github.com/puma/puma/blob/v4.0.0/lib/puma/detect.rb)

Tested via:

commits.message: chore: bump max puma version to 6.0

issue.title: Add ExAws.S3 example with Mix.install config
issue.body: Really I wanted to highlight the `:config` and `:system_env` ability from `Mix.install/2`. My actual use case was from a livebook where I needed to use [ConfigParser](https://hexdocs.pm/configparser_ex/) because of SSO.

comment.body: No worries. Thank you for the merge!

issue.title: UNIX domain socket no longer supported with relative path
issue.body: I'm not exactly sure where the change was, but for years I could connect with the following connection string: `postgres:///my_app_dev?host=.direnv/postgres`. After upgrading from `1.2.3` to `1.4.3` I could no longer use that relative path `.direnv/postgres`. Once I switched to `/home/jesse/path/to/my_app/.direnv/postgres` it worked again.

comment.body: I'm now wondering if there was a change in Rails/AR. Maybe it detects a relative path and yields an absolute path. I'll try to find some time to investigate that.

issue.title: Pandas-esque `describe` method
issue.body:
Are there any plans for a pandas-like `describe` method that would combine some of the aggregate methods (count, mean, standard deviation, peak) into a table to give you a rough understanding of a dataset, or is that out of scope of this library?

![1_CekpyUXF-TmP_m2YZCI7gg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699745/162600232-93823c59-871c-4c75-b791-357818e10749.png)

comment.body: I'm excited to see an open issue for this. We may be in need of profiling in the near term. I have no experience with Python or pandas, but I did just find [pandas-profiling](https://github.com/ydataai/pandas-profiling) which is maybe the 2.0 of this `describe/1` feature.

pull_request.body:
Bumps [commonmarker](https://github.com/gjtorikian/commonmarker) from 0.23.5 to 0.23.6.
Release notes

Sourced from commonmarker's releases.

v0.23.6

This release includes two updates from the upstream cmark-gfm library, namely:
